member.name: M:SkaaEditorUI.Presenters.ResIdxMultiBmpPresenter.GetSpriteStream
member.summary: Creates and returns a containing data for all objects in . The first four bytes are ignored as they are the file's size, which is not used in ResIdx files. The is reset to 0 before returning.

member.name: M:SkaaEditorUI.Presenters.ResIdxMultiBmpPresenter.ReadFrames(System.String,System.Drawing.Imaging.ColorPalette)
member.summary: Reads all the frame data from the specified file, of type
member.param: The to use in building the frame's image
member.returns: A where T1 is the new and T2 is the read from the ResIdx header.
member.remarks: This differs from loading an SPR file in that the file contains the data directly in its header rather than in the standard game set (see . The only has fields for FrameName and FrameOffset; any other data is stored elsewhere, generally in DBF (dBaseIII) files that may or may not be in the standard game set.

member.name: M:SkaaEditorUI.oldProject.LoadSprite(System.String,System.Drawing.Imaging.ColorPalette)
member.summary: Opens an SPR file and creates a object for it
member.param: The absolute path to the SPR file to open
member.remarks: The original game code for reading SPR files can be found ResourceDb::init_imported() in src/ORESDB.cpp around line 72. The resName will be "sprite\\NAME.SPR". SPR files are are considered FLAT by 7KAA.
